item.title: Yell Command
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

[quote=“luna-scape, post:12, topic:478632”]Use an IDE[/quote] WHY would he need an IDE? It’s most likely going to be a missing bracket. Umless you’re that uneducated.

item.title: Yell Command
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

100 errors means you either have an extra bracket or are missing one. If you want to add more rights to the yell command, then go ahead and do so. It isn’t hard because with the command I gave you, all you’d need to do is add more cases and change the playerRank string.

Read full topic

item.title: Yell Command
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

It isn’t broken; you only fix which is broken. You simply didn’t add the features you want it to do.

Declare this in Player.java:

In PlayerSave, add these:

[code]} else if (token.equals(“lastYell”)) {
p.lastyell = Integer.parseInt(token2);

characterfile.write("lastYell = ", 0, 11);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.lastyell), 0, Integer.toString(p.lastyell).length());
characterfile.newLine();[/code]

Use this yell command:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { if (Connection.isMuted(c)) { c.sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell."); return; } for (int j = 0; j < PlayerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (PlayerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[j]; String playerRank = "" switch(c.playerRights) { case 0: if(c.lastyell == 0) { playerRank = "Player"; } else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastyell < 30000) { c.sendMessage("You must wait 30 seconds to use this feature again."); c.sendMessage("Please wait another "+c.lastyell+" seconds"); return; } break; case 1: playerRank = "Mod"; break; case 2: playerRank = "Adming"; break; case 3: playerRank = "Owner"; break; case 4: playerRank = "Donator"; break; } c2.sendMessage("[" + playerRank + "]" + " " + c.playerName +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); } } }

And in Client.java, add this into your process method:

if(lastyell > 0) { lastyell -= 1; }

EDIT: Don’t ask where to put the PlayerSave.java or Player.java codes either.

Read full topic

item.title: Yell Command
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Your going to need to make a new timer. Something like this:

if (c.playerRights == 0) {//A checker to see if your player rights is 0, if not it will just ignore this c.yellTimer += 30; //a new timer you gotta do it yourself... but you have to do it so it initializes the timer }

Read full topic

item.title: Yell Command
item.dc:creator: @Lirimoo Lirimoo
item.description:
@Lirimoo wrote:

Hey. Could someone fix this yell Command for Vernix-PKz ?

So that Normal Players can use it , but only every 30 Seconds , and donators dont need to wait ?
Since players cant even use it.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { if (Connection.isMuted(c)) { c.sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell."); return; } for (int j = 0; j < PlayerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (PlayerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[j];

Please someone fix this for me .

Read full topic
